From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To select a ReadOnly or Upgrade ROMmon image to be booted on the next reload of a Cisco 7200 VXR router or Cisco 7301 router when you are in ROMmon, use the **rommon-pref** command in ROM monitor mode.

ParaDef.Info: Selects the ReadOnly ROMmon image to be booted on the next reload.

Examples: The following example, applicable to both the Cisco 7200 VXR and Cisco 7301 routers, shows how to select the ReadOnly ROMmon image to be booted on the next reload of the router when you are already in ROMmon mode:
ExtraInfo: You might select the ReadOnly ROMmon image to be booted on the next reload because the Upgrade image has features or side effects you do not like.When you are in ROMmon, there is no descriptive output to inform you whether the ReadOnly ROMmon image was reloaded. To confirm the reload, use the showmon command after entering the rommon-pref readonly command.Use this command when you are in ROMmon mode. Use the **upgrade rom-monitor preference** command when you are in Cisco IOS.

RelatedCmds.description: Shows both the ReadOnly and the Upgrade ROMmon image versions when you are in ROMmon mode, as well as which ROMmon image is running.
